NewMonopoly

Class Property

  • java.lang.Object
    • NewMonopoly.Property
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CProperty, RProperty, UProperty

    class Property
extends java.lang.Object
    Model class containing the necessary methods and variables for properties Specialized subclasses are necessary for full functionality. Subclasses are: CProperty, UProperty, and RProperty
    Author:
    Miguel Salazar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Property

        public Property(java.lang.String n,
                int p,
                int c,
                int o,
                int m,
                boolean mb,
                java.lang.String t)
        Constructor defining a Colored Property
        Parameters:
        n - a String for the Property's name
        p - int for the Property's position
        c - int for the Property's cost
        o - int for the Property's owner (default 0)
        m - int for the cost of mortgage for Property
        mb - boolean for the Property's mortgage status. false=not mortgaged, true=mortgaged
        t - String for the type of Property

        Returns:

        Returns:
        the id of the current owner

        Parameters:

      • getRent

        Returns:

      • getRent

        public int getRent(int i)
        Only used in Property Extensions. Returns nothing here.
        Parameters:
        i - any int, nothing will be done with it
        Returns:

      • getGrade

        public int getGrade()
        Only used in Color Properties. Returns nothing here.
        Returns:
        0

      • setGrade

        public void setGrade(int i)
        Only used in Color Properties. Returns nothing here.
        Parameters:
        i - any int, will not be used

      • getWorth

        public int getWorth()
        Method that calculates the worth of the property and returns that value. If property is mortgaged, only the mortgaged value is returned
        Returns:
        the total worth of the property

      • getGCount

        public GCounter getGCount()

      • toSave

        public java.lang.String toSave()
        Used for saving the property characteristic to a .mns file (renamed .txt file)
        Returns:
        a String containing the formated characteristic of the property for saving to a file

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the user friendly String containing the Property's characteristics
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String containing all the Property's characteristics
